InvalidAxioms:
:PrepositionalPhrase rdf:type The original T-CODEX tagset distinguished five subtypes of Adverbs, CausalAdverb, DirectionalAdverb, LocalAdverb, ModalAdverb, TemporalAdverb. In T-CODEX 2.1, these are conflated into a single Adverb category, tagged ADV.
These are now represented only in the GrammaticalFunction layer.

:neg rdf:type T-CODEX annotation was done using with a tool that requires for every annotation to establish its own markable Exmaralda, http://www.exmaralda.org. Thus, every annotation is a UnitOfAnnotation.

:prposs rdfs:subClassOf 2008-10-14 created by Svetlana Petrova content and Angelika Adam OWL modelling
2011-08-12 updated to T-CODEX v. 2.1, Christian Chiarcos Note: naming conventions for tags have been changed, the naming conventions of the individuals follow the *original* naming conventions for tags
      
Christian Chiarcos, chiarcos@uni-potsdam.de

:PredicativeAttribute rdfs:subClassOf T-CODEX annotation was done using with a tool that requires for every annotation to establish its own markable Exmaralda, http://www.exmaralda.org. Thus, every annotation is a UnitOfAnnotation.
OriginalAxioms: :InflectedPOS owl:versionInfo Category inserted in accordance with Petrova and Odebrecht 2011.

:InformationStructure owl:versionInfo T-CODEX annotation was done using with a tool that requires for every annotation to establish its own markable Exmaralda, http://www.exmaralda.org. Thus, every annotation is a UnitOfAnnotation.
:Pronoun owl:versionInfo Added for structural reasons, not a tag.

:Morpho-Syntactic owl:versionInfo T-CODEX annotation was done using with a tool that requires for every annotation to establish its own markable Exmaralda, http://www.exmaralda.org. Thus, every annotation is a UnitOfAnnotation.

:InitionalPosition owl:versionInfo In the original T-CODEX scheme, only a differentiation between initial and non-initial position were annotated. T-CODEX 2.1 has a more fine-grained subclassification of InitialPosition.

http://purl.org/olia/tcodex.owl owl:versionInfo 2008-10-14 created by Svetlana Petrova content and Angelika Adam OWL modelling
2011-08-12 updated to T-CODEX v. 2.1, Christian Chiarcos Note: naming conventions for tags have been changed, the naming conventions of the individuals follow the *original* naming conventions for tags
      
Christian Chiarcos, chiarcos@uni-potsdam.de
:NonInflectedPOS owl:versionInfo Category inserted in accordance with Petrova and Odebrecht 2011.

:Adverb owl:versionInfo The original T-CODEX tagset distinguished five subtypes of Adverbs, CausalAdverb, DirectionalAdverb, LocalAdverb, ModalAdverb, TemporalAdverb. In T-CODEX 2.1, these are conflated into a single Adverb category, tagged ADV.
These are now represented only in the GrammaticalFunction layer.
:Verb owl:versionInfo Added for structural reasons, not a tag.
